snippet: For three straight years, a farming county has had the highest fertility rate in South Korea, a rare bright spot in a country some doomsayers predicted would become “extinct” in several centuries.
abstract: Haenam Journal; South Korean government wages fertility campaign, reversing efforts in previous decades to promote contraception; farming community in country's southwest is first region to achieve and exceed replacement level of 2.1 children per woman, result of range of local programs aimed at easing burdens of parenthood.
lead_paragraph: For three straight years, a farming county has had the highest fertility rate in South Korea, a rare bright spot in a country some doomsayers predicted would become “extinct” in several centuries.

headline.print_headline: A Campaign for More Babies Bears Fruit in South Korea
headline.main: Korean County Achieves Its Goal: Less Birth Control, More Babies
